text.content:
ED NURSING ASSESSMENT:
Chief Complaint: pt to ER bed 3 via wheel chair.  CP 10/10.  MD at bedside.  On 
monitor, O2 @ 6L/min.  PIV, Labs, EKG by triage nurse.  PIV #18 L ac.  SL nitro 
#1 given with no relief. 

10:28 2mg MSO4 IVP.  Pain reduced to 8/10.

10:32 Port Chest Xray completed by tech

10:33 2nd SL nitro.  CP still 10/10.

10:38 3rd SL nitro, no relief, CP 10/10.

10:42 Trop neg, EKG neg, skin dry.  Lab called, LFTs added on to chem 7 
previously sent.  CP remains 9 to 10.  SpO2 100% on 6 L.

10:48 pain remins 9 to 10/10, MD notified.

10:56 4mg hydromorphone tab given.

10:58 MD ordered ABD US.  Tech at bedside.

11:06 Pain improving 6/10




APPEARANCE: Acute distress
MOBILITY: transfered to stretcher with minimal assist
Assistive devices used: n/a
MENTAL SCREEN:
Alert and responsive.
Oriented to name, place, date, SS#
PAIN ASSESSMENT (WILDCATS)
   Patient denies pain or discomfort. 
 
SYSTEMS REVIEW:
   SKIN:
   Skin Color
      Normal for ethnic group 
   Temperature
      Warm 
   Skin Moisture
      Dry
   PULMONARY:
Respirations
   Normal 

Lungs:
   Clear  LUL, LLL, RUL, RML, RLL
Cough
No cough 
   ABDOMINAL ASSESSMENT
   Abdomen    soft
   Bowel sounds: normal
   Bowel Frequency 
   GI problems    none 
   Patient is continent
text.author: NURSE,SEVEN

text.content:
11:25 - pain 5/10.  NSR on monitor, 131/67.  SpO2 99%

12:00 - 1st dose pip/taz.  Patient will be admitted, awaiting bed and orders.

12:03 - O2 titrated to 2 L/min.  Spo2 = 97%

12:30 - patient ambulated to Bathroom with minimal assist.  Void x 1 300 cc pale 
yellow.  Pain 6/10.

12:45 - NSR on monitor, 138/72.  SpO2 = 98%

13:00 -  Pain 5/10.  patient is hungry/thirsty. MD notified - awaiting orders 
from admitting providers.  ice chips provided.


13:42 - NSR on monitor.  129/68; 84; 99%.  Pain 3/10

14:51 - Bed will be ready on Obs at 1500.  Report called to charge nurse Sally 
Smith.  Patient belongings sent home with a friend.

15:00 - Patient transport to obs unit by tech Joe.  BP 146/81, HR 91, 99% on 2L. 
Pain 5/10.
text.author: NURSE,SEVEN

nationalTitle.title: RN EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT E & M NOTE
